title: Hydrogen sulfide sensor
text:
A hydrogen sulfide sensor or H2S sensor is a <a href="gas%20sensor">gas sensor</a> for the measurement of <a href="hydrogen%20sulfide">hydrogen sulfide</a>.
Principle.
The H2S sensor is a <a href="metal%20oxide%20semiconductor">metal oxide semiconductor</a> (MOS) sensor which operates by a reversible change in <a href="Electrical%20resistance">resistance</a> caused by <a href="adsorption">adsorption</a> and <a href="desorption">desorption</a> of hydrogen sulfide in a film with hydrogen sulfide sensitive material like <a href="tin%20oxide">tin oxide</a> <a href="thick%20film">thick film</a>s and <a href="gold">gold</a> <a href="thin%20film">thin film</a>s. Current response time is 25 ppb to 10 ppm < one minute.
Applications.
This type of sensor has been under constant development because of the toxic and corrosive nature of hydrogen sulfide:
